Articles.Content:
Right now it's not finished.

If you want to see the development of the project, it is here:

[Link removed by moderator]

Hello @ForumUser,

I can tell you're really enthusiastic about wanting to help the KSP community.  Unfortunately, you're linking to a website that does not have appropriate guidance for legal/licensing requirements, so unfortunately it's not allowed to be linked to.  Accordingly, we've removed the link.  Please do not post a link to the website in the KSP forums until you have received approval from a moderator to do so.

Your website currently attempts to address this issue simply by saying,

Quote

Email me here: [email protected]

MODPACK 1

DESCRIPTION

MODPACK 2

MODPACK 3

(REMEMBER TO KEEP THINGS LEGAL)

...Unfortunately, that's not enough.  Saying "REMEMBER TO KEEP THINGS LEGAL" isn't sufficient.  You need sufficient, explicit guidelines about specific requirements that must be met in order for something to be posted on your site.  That's non-trivial to do-- note the verbosity of the add-on posting guidelines here:

Yes, it's a hassle.  Sorry, but there's nothing that can be done about that.  Licenses need to be respected, and sites that distribute licensed content need to have an explicitly stated policy about ensuring that such licenses are adhered to.  "REMEMBER TO KEEP IT LEGAL" isn't sufficient.

...Also, this thread here is the 2nd thread you already have for your website.  Since this is a duplicate thread, closing it in favor of your first one, located here:

Thank you for your understanding.
